channel.title: New laptop
channel.description:
I dont custom build computers, but my dad bought a 1200$ laptop for himself and after realizing it was too big, he gave it to me :P Its brand new.
anyway i want to know if this is a good laptop when it comes to games, it can run RS at 1600x900 max settings with x4 AA on the grand exchange completely smooth, but that's a bad example because real games do more damage than that :P
hp pavilion dv7 notebook pc intel core quad cpu q900 @ 2.00ghz 6gb ram 64 bit
gfx: ati readeon hd 4650 graphics with 1024mb dedicated video memory
If you need anymore info just lemme know, Im not a big hardware guy so i may not know how to find some things XD

item.title: New laptop
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

la­wl:

get it off steam

I have xbl so if i wanted to play play it id just play it on LIVE. I wanted it for the pc for mods and i cba to buy it.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 06, 2009, 01:41:11 pm[/size][hr]

I run it with 2x AA (It can run x4 fine) to make sure i don’t get a heap or something in a packed zone.

Beautiful

item.title: New laptop
item.dc:creator: @Starting_up Starting up ...
item.description:
@Starting_up wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:4, topic:299319”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=395637.msg2939427#msg2939427 date=1251762057]
Easily could run CoD4, likely Crysis on medium/high.

Also great for some high polygon modelling and rendering
[/quote]
Haha yea. C4D in 1600x900 is fkn amazing. I also hooked it up to a spare 1050x900 moniter we have so now i gots tooo scweeennnsss

Im probably going to get gta4 and fallout on this baby XD

402GB hard space btw[/quote]To bad they don’t make GTA4 for PC…
